title: Riot help me pls
body:
I got a chat restriction can you identify the game where I was toxic so I can understand what I did wrong?

EDIT: Got the email and a notification when I logged on the next day :/

replies.body:
You would have been emailed your reform card. It goes to the email address you signed up with.

I had a look at the game where Instant Feedback picked you up. You're being verbally abusive towards your team mates. This escalates throughout the game and you're also using racist references.

My suggestion would be to calm down when things don't go your way in a game and try to communicate positively with your team mates. 

It's a chat restriction now, but if you don't reform your behaviour it will result in a ban.
Yea I got the email and a notification when I logged on just now :/ I hope the people who were trolling in the game got some sought of punishment at least?

They most likely did if they were repeat offenders but Riot isn't allowed to say. It's really nice to see people wanting to know what they did wrong and get better though tbh. I wish you the best of luck on the rift :)
no reds answering this question...strange

It's really not. The only notification you get that a player was punished is through the Instant Feedback System, and I'm pretty sure that, currently, it only notifies the last person to have reported the "toxic" player before said "toxic" player got punished. Riot employees themselves never notify players if other players got punished.
If they're on your friends list you should be able to see their match history on the official League match history [located here: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/]

Makes you wonder....
Being a dick to a dick doesn't make you any less of a dick.

>So asking players to turtle or play same is now considered as toxic.....
Or buy wards so you don't get ganked..the list goes on....

None of these will get you banned, swearing your ass off while saying them can, because your just being a dick about it.

I have over 2k norms, and 1k ARAMs, and like 500 ranked games, I've played with all the kinds of stupid in this game (even the types i would call "friend")

But nothing justify's being abusive to anyone one in this game, and yes i lose my cool, and it's not at people who are "stupid" or not doing the right thing, because they damn well probably don't know any better.

It's at people who are just downright assholes, fact is their is never any justification to be abusing someone for tilting.

Now this OP may pretend that this is the first time that he has abused anyone, but the report system says otherwise and no amount of abuse is allowed to anyone, even the ones that ruin games deliberately (and that is just giving them a reaction.)

I don't believe the OP ever tried to say this was the first time, and in the end, even just saying he is trying to improve is a step in the right direction, I'm not justifying his past actions, I'm commending his present ones. That aside though I 100% agree with everything else you said. There's never a valid excuse to be toxic.
Oh yeah just should add it as a note, this isn't anything against the OP, it's mostly the people who actually try to justify being assholes on league just because there is assholes on league.
Oh ok, my mistake :) Just sorta came off that way. Agreed.

Not to mention the script checks for words, so lets say i made a new account, and didn't say a word in chat and only made pings, and got reported by 4 players a game, the report system would notice and wouldn't ban me for this.

I believe you should get an emailed reform card with the last game that gave you the restriction, I know it is that way for bans but I am unsure about chat restrictions. If you give a bit more info I'm sure some other people can help you out a bit. LIke LittleGanker mentioned, if it's only in champ select then it's just the anti spam feature and won't affect you past that champ select, but if it's ingame then I believe (but am not certain) you should have gotten emailed a reform card. If you haven't, best bet is to send a support ticket and ask about it, they should be able to give you the chat log at least.
